title: Figma Launches Three AI-Powered Image Editing Tools to Streamline Design Workflows

paragraphs.content: Figma has unveiled **three new AI-driven image editing tools**—Erase object, Isolate object, and Expand image—designed to eliminate the need for designers to export files to external software. These features, announced in December 2025, integrate directly into the Figma canvas, allowing users to perform precision edits without relying on text prompts or jumping between applications. The tools represent a significant step forward in reducing workflow friction, particularly for teams managing visual assets across multiple formats and platforms.

paragraphs.content: The new capabilities are now available in Figma Design and Draw for users with Full seats on Professional, Organization, and Enterprise plans with AI enabled. Figma has consolidated these tools alongside existing features like Remove background and Crop into a unified toolbar for seamless access. The company plans to expand availability across its platform throughout 2026, signaling its commitment to becoming a more comprehensive design hub that reduces reliance on specialized editing software.

sections.title: Precision Editing Without Text Prompts: How the Three Tools Work

paragraphs.content: The **Erase object** tool allows designers to select and remove unwanted elements from images using an upgraded lasso selection method, while the image automatically preserves surrounding background details and color characteristics. **Isolate object** enables users to separate subjects from their backgrounds, then apply granular adjustments such as modifying lighting, shadows, color balance, and focus—or effects like blur and desaturation. **Expand image** intelligently extends image backgrounds to fit different aspect ratios, enabling designers to repurpose assets across formats, such as converting a square product shot into a landscape web banner without distortion.

paragraphs.content: A key differentiator from competitors is that these tools operate without requiring text prompts, making them more accessible for designers seeking fine-tuned control rather than generative capabilities. The consolidated toolbar prioritizes the Remove background option prominently, reflecting its status as one of the most frequently used actions on the platform. This design philosophy positions Figma's approach as fundamentally different from generative models, which excel at creation but lack the granular editing precision that design teams need for asset optimization.

sections.title: Workflow Efficiency Gains for Marketing and Design Teams

paragraphs.content: These tools directly address a critical bottleneck in design workflows: the need to export images for editing and reimport them back into Figma. For marketers and product teams, the Expand image feature eliminates repetitive cropping and repositioning tasks when adapting creative assets for different ad sizes, social formats, and CMS constraints. Content teams can now perform rapid test variations without waiting for designer availability, while performance marketers gain faster turnaround on background cleanup and object repositioning.

Design-stage optimization benefits cross-functional reviews, as stakeholders can now visualize small edits on the fly within the mockup itself, reducing back-and-forth iterations between draft and final assets. By keeping AI assistance contextual and assistive rather than disruptive, Figma maintains user control throughout the editing process. These efficiency gains position the platform as a more complete visual design hub, reducing the multi-app chaos that has historically fragmented creative production.
